content: Hey!

The timestamp in your last message (14:24) suggests it‚Äôs currently **14:24 Mountain Time (MST, UTC-7)** in Colorado.

Since Texas is **Central Time (CT, UTC-6)**, it‚Äôs currently **15:24** there for your parents.

If you‚Äôd like, I can adjust future responses to explicitly note your timezone in the timestamps‚Äîjust let me know! Otherwise, I‚Äôll keep using the info we‚Äôve got. üòä

Ok, so the timestamps reflect my local time, but does not contain specific timezone information?

The timestamps in our conversation *do* include timezone information‚Äîit‚Äôs embedded in the format you see (e.g., `2026-01-25T14:26:19-07:00`). The `-07:00` indicates **UTC-7**, which matches Mountain Time (MST) for Colorado.

I inferred your timezone earlier when you mentioned your location (CO) and asked about Texas time. The system automatically applies this offset to all timestamps in our chat.

Want me to clarify anything else about how the timestamps work? Or should we switch topics? üòä
